fields.description:
In Jira settings -> issues -> statuses (<instancename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa)

When using French as a personal language, the status Open is translated as Ouvrir, when it should be Ouvert.
Ouvrir means To Open (the verb) and not Open (the adjective)
fields.summary: Jira Cloud status Open is mistranslated in French

fields.description: The footer appears on many Jira pages, most notably the logon and profile page.
fields.summary: Atlassian information footer in English when the profile is in French

fields.description: When looking at linked items in an epic and using a French profile, the status indicators of the linked items are showing up in English even though there are translated values for the status messages.  Please see the graphic showing the linked status of user story TE-531 which says DRAFT.  When viewing TE-531 on its own, the French value of ÉBAUCHE does appear.  The same issue appears for other linked status values as well as the view workflow selection.   This might be more a bug than a translation issue.
fields.summary: Linked Item status messages are showing up in English only

fields.description:
In the Jira individual task view there's a dropdown box where it says "Komkmentit", when it should actually be "Kommentit". The other items in that dropdown menu are "Historia", "Työloki" and "Emails". "Emails" should be translated to "Sähköpostit".

 !2019-08-05_01_Selection.png|thumbnail! 

Original tickets: 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72680
https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-499147

fields.description:
- first impressions checklist right hand side panel available for landers, to guide them through the process of getting to know JSD.
- second task from the bottom (attached screenshot).

It's not easy to get it right in Polish really as I can see why this went wrong. {projectName} placeholder is requiring us to insert the name of the project, but nouns in Polish, depending on their position and usage in the sentence, have different suffixes to be grammatically correct.

Even as a dev I would struggle to provide a good enough solution with current way of things. It's not a trivial problem to solve...
fields.summary: First Impressions Checklist translation has some problems

fields.description:
From
https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/browse/PTDF-2360

Customer says

> Hello. The translation to portuguese was based on the portuguese from Portugal and some words and expressions are a litte bit strange to me as a Brazilian. Can this be reviewed in order to use more neutral terms or create separated translations?
And this is just a sugestion, the current translation doesn't affect the understanding, it just feels a bit strange.

fields.description:
based on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TRANS-2582 and https://translation.atlassian.net/browse/LF-269

Still have Italian speakers reporting this problem in current Jira Server versions, see also https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Jira-8-italian-translation/qaq-p/1174303

LF-269 has been marked as closed - duplicate to LF-245 , but there is not a clear indication as to which version of the translation plugin/version of Jira might contain this fix.   This would be very helpful to understand so that users don't have to continually keep editing their own translations every time they have to upgrade.
 
If we could just indicate what version contains this fix, it might help avoid more frustrated customers that can no longer create their own service requests for translations.
fields.summary: The "issue" concept and other inaccurate Italian translations - redux

fields.description:
Hello team,

There is a untranslated phrase and a typo in the Portuguese translation of Jira. Here are the steps to locate it:

{panel}
# Click on the *Jira Admiministation Icon* > *Projects*.
# Select any project. 
# Select *Screens* at the sidebar.
# Click on the dropdown for any of the screen schemes available.
{panel}

Now the steps in Portuguese:

{panel}
# Click on Ícone de Administração Jira* > *Projetos*.
# Select any project.
# Select *Telas* at the sidebar.
# Click on the dropdown for any of the screen schemes available.
{panel}

As we can see in the screenshot the phrase "These 4 iissue types... ...use this screen scheme" has not been translated and has a typo. Would you kindly look into it?

Kind regards,

Gregory Peres
Jira Server Support
fields.summary: Typo and untranslated phrase.

Go to any Jira issue (New Jira issue view) and scroll down to the Activity section.

With an empty Kanban board, there's an empty state which prompts the user to create a new issue.
The portuguese translation for this is using an incorrect pronoun "criar uma item" when the correct would be "criar um item".
That might have stemmed from the fact that the translation might have been "criar uma issue" in the past, which was a valid use of a foreign world in Portuguese..

fields.description:
When you resolve an inssue and change the resolution status the system put an "Automatic response" on the user view.

In my test the english text is:

"Your request status changed to Resolvido with resolution Concluído."

The portuguese Brazil text is:

"O status do seu chamado foi alterado de Resolvido para a resolução Concluído."

The correct translate should be:

"O status do seu chamado foi alterado para Resolvido com a resolução Concluído."

If the portuguese text were translatade into english it would look something like this:

"Your request status has changed from Resolvido to resolution Concluído.
fields.summary: Problem Translation of Portuguese Brazil

fields.description:
The main Jira Cloud UI uses browser language (Accept-Language) to apply UI language settings. However, some parts of the Jira Product use the user settings language as their source of truth. This is currently set by default to English, which results in users seeing side menus and some other text in English.

Our locale application needs to be updated as the wrong source of truth is being referenced and English should be removed as a default for all customers, and replaced with the browser language (Accept-Language) setting as a default
fields.summary: Incorrect Locale allocation causes English to show in the UI

At least mine translation this is what I'd expect.

fields.description:
Client reports the following:

In Jira issues preview:

The title that appears when using the Spanish language must be "Enlaces" because in addition to links to issues, it also contains links to Confluence and external links.

Actually the translation in Spanish is "Enlace a Incidencias" (Link to Issues).

The title could confuse users and make it difficult to find information.

 

[https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/CA-813647]

 

I'm unsure if this is the corect way to report this so please let me know if it is not!
fields.summary: Spanish Translation change request

Hello,

We are working on Jira v7.13.2 The default langage is French. All our issues type are created in French. I have translated 2 issue type in english (UK & USA).

Bug : Translation is not effective when I want to create an issue. But it works nice once the issue has been created.

Can you help me on this ?

Thanks a lot

*Summary* 

There are some missing german translations in the confluence UI.
 "erstellt von Fabian Rahm letzte Aktualisierung less than a minute ago"

*Environment*
 Confluence Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
 1.Update any page 
 2. Check the page in view mode and see "erstellt von Fabian Rahm letzte Aktualisierung less than a minute ago"

*Expected Results*
The complete message should be in German.

*Actual Results*
 It shows half in german and English "erstellt von Fabian Rahm letzte Aktualisierung less than a minute ago"

The Polish translation of the word "Comment" in the email notification received from Jira is "koemntarz" which is incorrect
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change personal setting language to "polski"
 # Set Notifications of your changes to Notify Me
 # Add a comment to an issue and save

h3. Expected Results
 * Email received would have the correct translation "komentarz"

h3. Actual Results

Email received has an incorrect translation "koemntarz"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No available workaround
fields.summary: Polish translation of the word "Comment" is incorrect

fields.description:
Although the word "Видимо" literally means "Visible", this particular form and lack of context would rather be interpreted as "Maybe" or "Likely", e.g. "Likely 5 issues", which is confusing.

The proper translation of "visible" here I believe would be "Выбрано" ("Selected"), "Отфильтровано" ("Filtered out") or "Отображено" ("Shown").

fields.description:
Same issue and workaround as described in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-questions/New-Release-causes-JIRA-Exception-Uncaught-TypeError-t-widget/qaq-p/1046688] when using *InProduct translation for Jira* v1.2.0

However, differently, from "_view boards_" as described in Community, the issue was noticed when in {color:#0000ff}Project Settings >> Versions{color} as view just loads and never completes.

The following gets thrown in Web Browser's console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: t.widget.extend is not a function
    at t.<computed>.<computed>._createWidget (batch.js?locale=en-US:970)
    at new t.<computed>.<computed> (batch.js?locale=en-US:970)
    at HTMLTableSectionElement.<anonymous> (batch.js?locale=en-US:970)
    at Function.each (batch.js?locale=en-US:54)
    at c.fn.init.each (batch.js?locale=en-US:54)
    at c.fn.init.t.fn.<computed> [as sortable] (batch.js?locale=en-US:970)
    at d.makeSortable (com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page-assets.js?locale=en-US:39)
    at d.onRender (com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page-assets.js?locale=en-US:39)
    at d.triggerMethod (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jmbonb=1&locale=en-US:2991)
    at d.render (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jmbonb=1&locale=en-US:3012)
{noformat}
As the Community suggested, disabling Javascript allowed {color:#0000ff}Project Settings >> Versions{color} to be displayed, however, this is not a valid workaround are because you can no longer translate anything on the boards.

For the time being Jira's REST API endpoint is being consumed:
{noformat}
curl -k -u {username} \
     -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
     -H 'Accept: application/json' \
     -X GET http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/versions
{noformat}
fields.summary: InProduct Translation v1.2.0 causes t.widget.extend is not a function
Translation english into german

fields.description:
The default overview template always shows up in *English* even if the indexing language is changed to German.
The workaround:

The template can be edited through [Global Template section|https://i22team.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/templates2/listglobaltemplates.action] from *Confluence Admin* portal.

Follow the below steps to edit them:
 # Navigate to *System templates*
 # Edit the *Default Personal Space Content*

You can then change the template content from *English* to *German*.

It changes in *Server Edition* but not for *Cloud version*
fields.summary: Change the default overview page to German language
"Issuse" should translate to "事件" instead of “问题".
New Dutch Translation
French translation - Forgotten password procedure "Envoyer moi un email" -> "EnvoyeZ moi un email"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Confluence is set to Spanish, the index language list displays the following

!Screen Shot 2019-04-02 at 4.20.23 PM.png|thumbnail!

The above index language list has all the available language that can be indexed. Notice that the text "Spanish" and "Espanol". The text "Spanish" is wrong and supposed to "Inglés" representing English. This is seen in Confluence 6.15.1, 6.12.1, 6.13.1 and it is presumed to be seen in other versions too.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the Confluence language to Spanish (in the login page select Spanish)
 # Login and then head over to *General Configuration*
 # Click *Edit* and find *Indexing Languages*

h3. Expected Results

All the available indexing languages translated in Spanish
h3. Actual Results

The text "Spanish" is in on of the options, this should be "Inglés"
fields.summary: When Confluence is set to Spanish, the index language list translates the text "English" as "Spanish"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The description of the bug issue type has been translated to jira.translation.issuetype.bug.name.desc when new instances/projects are created. (Intermittent)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project or instance
# Go to > *Jira settings > *Issues* > *Issue types*
# Check the description of the bug issue type

h3. Expected Results
The description of the bug issue type is translated to *A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.*

h3. Actual Results

The page won't load and the following error is displayed:

_jira.translation.issuetype.bug.name.desc_
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-15 at 12.16.09.png|thumbnail! 


 h3. Notes
This problem is intermittent, but once apply the workaround described below, this problem shouldn't occur anymore.

h3. Notes
Go to *Edit* and overwrite with the following correct description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
fields.summary: The description of the bug issue type  has been translated to jira.translation.issuetype.bug.name.desc

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
InProcduct Translation for JIRA was not supporting JIRA 8.0. It will cause projects to be crash. This plugin widely used by users to correct translation bugs while waiting for Atlassian Translation Bug Fix team to fix the translation bug in next release. Hence, this plugin was really important.

Plugin is currently an [Atlassian Labs  | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/33202/atlassian-labs] feature and only available for JIRA Server 7.0.0 - 7.9.2 although it was being tested by some users in JIRA 7.13.0 working fine.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update InProduct Translation to support JIRA 8.0 onwards.
 
h3. Workaround
There is a workaround which is to manually unzips the language pack jar file and re-correct the language. However, this is not a good workaround as it is time-consuming, too technical for users and required downtime to apply the JAR file.
fields.summary: InProduct Translation for JIRA to Support JIRA 8.0 onwards

fields.description:
From Support Case:

In the cloud version of confluence translated into Italian we read "seguaci" but the correct term for watchers is instead "osservatori" how I can translate right this term ? Is there a site where I can help you translate well into Italian?
